entry.title: Thomas Illyricus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the itinerant preacher Thomas Illyricus (pictured) wrote early critiques of Martin Luther based only on sources that Luther would accept?

entry.title: Michael Huber (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Michael Huber's translation of Salomon Gessner's works into French made Gessner the best-known German-language poet in Europe before Goethe?

entry.title: 24 Hour Psycho (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 24 Hour Psycho slows down Alfred Hitchcock's 1960 film Psycho to two frames per second, stretching its duration to a full 24 hours?

entry.title: Moenadi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Moenadi was reportedly offered the post of Governor of Central Java during a flight?

entry.title: Vampire (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Olivia Rodrigo wears two interlaced purple Band-Aids in the artwork for her song "Vampire"?

entry.title: Peter Fallon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Peter Fallon, an Irish poet who translated Virgil's Georgics, also edited a 1970 beat-poetry magazine that featured works by John Lennon and Allen Ginsberg?

entry.title: Alone in the Dark (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the story for Infogrames' 1992 computer game Alone in the Dark was outlined in just three days?

entry.title: squirrels are "nearly ubiquitous" on college campuses (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that research conducted in 2020 found that squirrels are "nearly ubiquitous" on college campuses in the United States and Canada?
